intro: Erythrospermum paniculatum, commonly known as the red-flowered hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its striking red, tubular flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with woody stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers have five petals and a prominent, five-lobed stigma, typical of the Malvaceae family. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and coastal areas.
